result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damion Lamont Ashford Sr

records.addlTxt: Upon request from Defense, Court rescheduled scheduling conference to November 15, 2022 at 8:30 AM.  Parties notified of court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.

Defendant Damion Lamont Ashford Sr in court.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for Damion Lamont Ashford Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 09/16/2022 to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 11/01/2022. th

Defendant Damion Lamont Ashford Sr in court.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Damion Lamont Ashford Sr.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Andrew Golden as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Golden accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 11/01/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Case is adjourned for a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Indigency hearing on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Damion Lamont Ashford Sr appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.
Indigency hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Damion Lamont Ashford in court with Attorney Haley E Wentz.     Madeline Witte, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VVB,MDB,CLB,CWB,ASB.  
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department requests a signature bond be set as Defendant is hospitalized.  Court GRANTS request.  Case adjourned.  Adjourned Initial Appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
